categories.name: Possible Errors
categories.description: The following rules point out areas where you might have made mistakes.

rules.name: no-cond-assign
rules.description: disallow assignment in conditional expressions

rules.name: no-console
rules.description: disallow use of console (off by default in the node environment)

rules.name: no-constant-condition
rules.description: disallow use of constant expressions in conditions

rules.name: no-comma-dangle
rules.description: disallow trailing commas in object literals

rules.name: no-control-regex
rules.description: disallow control characters in regular expressions

rules.name: no-debugger
rules.description: disallow use of debugger

rules.name: no-dupe-keys
rules.description: disallow duplicate keys when creating object literals

rules.name: no-empty
rules.description: disallow empty statements

rules.name: no-empty-class
rules.description: disallow the use of empty character classes in regular expressions

rules.name: no-ex-assign
rules.description: disallow assigning to the exception in a catch block

rules.name: no-extra-boolean-cast
rules.description: disallow double-negation boolean casts in a boolean context

rules.name: no-extra-parens
rules.description: disallow unnecessary parentheses (off by default)

rules.name: no-extra-semi
rules.description: disallow unnecessary semicolons

rules.name: no-func-assign
rules.description: disallow overwriting functions written as function declarations

rules.name: no-inner-declarations
rules.description: disallow function or variable declarations in nested blocks

rules.name: no-invalid-regexp
rules.description: disallow invalid regular expression strings in the RegExp constructor

rules.name: no-negated-in-lhs
rules.description: disallow negation of the left operand of an in expression

rules.name: no-obj-calls
rules.description: disallow the use of object properties of the global object (Math and JSON) as functions

rules.name: no-regex-spaces
rules.description: disallow multiple spaces in a regular expression literal

rules.name: no-sparse-arrays
rules.description: disallow sparse arrays

rules.name: no-unreachable
rules.description: disallow unreachable statements after a return, throw, continue, or break statement

rules.name: use-isnan
rules.description: disallow comparisons with the value NaN

rules.name: valid-jsdoc
rules.description: Ensure JSDoc comments are valid (off by default)

rules.name: valid-typeof
rules.description: Ensure that the results of typeof are compared against a valid string

categories.name: Best Practices
categories.description: These are rules designed to prevent you from making mistakes. They either prescribe a better way of doing something or help you avoid footguns.

rules.name: block-scoped-var
rules.description: treat var statements as if they were block scoped (off by default)

rules.name: complexity
rules.description: specify the maximum cyclomatic complexity allowed in a program (off by default)

rules.name: consistent-return
rules.description: require return statements to either always or never specify values

rules.name: curly
rules.description: specify curly brace conventions for all control statements

rules.name: default-case
rules.description: require default case in switch statements (off by default)

rules.name: dot-notation
rules.description: encourages use of dot notation whenever possible

rules.name: eqeqeq
rules.description: require the use of === and !==

rules.name: guard-for-in
rules.description: make sure for-in loops have an if statement (off by default)

rules.name: no-alert
rules.description: disallow the use of alert, confirm, and prompt

rules.name: no-caller
rules.description: disallow use of arguments.caller or arguments.callee

rules.name: no-div-regex
rules.description: disallow division operators explicitly at beginning of regular expression (off by default)

rules.name: no-else-return
rules.description: disallow else after a return in an if (off by default)

rules.name: no-empty-label
rules.description: disallow use of labels for anything other then loops and switches

rules.name: no-eq-null
rules.description: disallow comparisons to null without a type-checking operator (off by default)

rules.name: no-eval
rules.description: disallow use of eval()

rules.name: no-extend-native
rules.description: disallow adding to native types

rules.name: no-fallthrough
rules.description: disallow fallthrough of case statements

rules.name: no-floating-decimal
rules.description: disallow the use of leading or trailing decimal points in numeric literals (off by default)

rules.name: no-implied-eval
rules.description: disallow use of eval()-like methods

rules.name: no-labels
rules.description: disallow use of labeled statements

rules.name: no-iterator
rules.description: disallow usage of __iterator__ property

rules.name: no-lone-blocks
rules.description: disallow unnecessary nested blocks

rules.name: no-loop-func
rules.description: disallow creation of functions within loops

rules.name: no-multi-str
rules.description: disallow use of multiline strings

rules.name: no-native-reassign
rules.description: disallow reassignments of native objects

rules.name: no-new
rules.description: disallow use of new operator when not part of the assignment or comparison

rules.name: no-new-func
rules.description: disallow use of new operator for Function object

rules.name: no-new-wrappers
rules.description: disallows creating new instances of String,Number, and Boolean

rules.name: no-octal
rules.description: disallow use of octal literals

rules.name: no-octal-escape
rules.description: disallow use of octal escape sequences in string literals, such as var foo = "Copyright \251";

rules.name: no-proto
rules.description: disallow usage of __proto__ property

rules.name: no-redeclare
rules.description: disallow declaring the same variable more then once

rules.name: no-return-assign
rules.description: disallow use of assignment in return statement

rules.name: no-script-url
rules.description: disallow use of javascript: urls.

rules.name: no-self-compare
rules.description: disallow comparisons where both sides are exactly the same (off by default)

rules.name: no-sequences
rules.description: disallow use of comma operator

rules.name: no-unused-expressions
rules.description: disallow usage of expressions in statement position

rules.name: no-warning-comments
rules.description: disallow usage of configurable warning terms in comments

rules.name: no-with
rules.description: disallow use of the with statement

rules.name: radix
rules.description: require use of the second argument for parseInt() (off by default)

rules.name: wrap-iife
rules.description: require immediate function invocation to be wrapped in parentheses (off by default)

rules.name: yoda
rules.description: require or disallow Yoda conditions

categories.name: Strict Mode
categories.description: These rules relate to using strict mode.

rules.name: no-global-strict
rules.description: disallow the "use strict" pragma in the global scope (off by default in the node environment)

rules.name: no-extra-strict
rules.description: disallow unnecessary use of "use strict"; when already in strict mode

rules.name: strict
rules.description: require that all functions are run in strict mode

categories.name: Variables
categories.description: These rules have to do with variable declarations.

rules.name: no-catch-shadow
rules.description: disallow the catch clause parameter name being the same as a variable in the outer scope (off by default in the node environment)

rules.name: no-delete-var
rules.description: disallow deletion of variables

rules.name: no-label-var
rules.description: disallow labels that share a name with a variable

rules.name: no-shadow
rules.description: disallow declaration of variables already declared in the outer scope

rules.name: no-shadow-restricted-names
rules.description: disallow shadowing of names such as arguments

rules.name: no-undef
rules.description: disallow use of undeclared variables unless mentioned in a /*global */ block

rules.name: no-undefined
rules.description: disallow use of undefined variable (off by default)

rules.name: no-undef-init
rules.description: disallow use of undefined when initializing variables

rules.name: no-unused-vars
rules.description: disallow declaration of variables that are not used in the code

rules.name: no-use-before-define
rules.description: disallow use of variables before they are defined

categories.name: Node.js
categories.description: These rules are specific to JavaScript running on Node.js.

rules.name: handle-callback-err
rules.description: enforces error handling in callbacks (off by default) (on by default in the node environment)

rules.name: no-mixed-requires
rules.description: disallow mixing regular variable and require declarations (off by default) (on by default in the node environment)

rules.name: no-new-require
rules.description: disallow use of new operator with the require function (off by default) (on by default in the node environment)

rules.name: no-path-concat
rules.description: disallow string concatenation with __dirname and __filename (off by default) (on by default in the node environment)

rules.name: no-process-exit
rules.description: disallow process.exit() (on by default in the node environment)

rules.name: no-restricted-modules
rules.description: restrict usage of specified node modules (off by default)

rules.name: no-sync
rules.description: disallow use of synchronous methods (off by default)

categories.name: Stylistic Issues
categories.description: These rules are purely matters of style and are quite subjective.

rules.name: brace-style
rules.description: enforce one true brace style (off by default)

rules.name: camelcase
rules.description: require camel case names

rules.name: consistent-this
rules.description: enforces consistent naming when capturing the current execution context (off by default)

rules.name: eol-last
rules.description: enforce newline at the end of file, with no multiple empty lines

rules.name: func-names
rules.description: require function expressions to have a name (off by default)

rules.name: func-style
rules.description: enforces use of function declarations or expressions (off by default)

rules.name: new-cap
rules.description: require a capital letter for constructors

rules.name: new-parens
rules.description: disallow the omission of parentheses when invoking a contructor with no arguments

rules.name: no-nested-ternary
rules.description: disallow nested ternary expressions (off by default)

rules.name: no-array-constructor
rules.description: disallow use of the Array constructor

rules.name: no-lonely-if
rules.description: disallow if as the only statement in an else block (off by default)

rules.name: no-new-object
rules.description: disallow use of the Object constructor

rules.name: no-spaced-func
rules.description: disallow space between function identifier and application

rules.name: no-space-before-semi
rules.description: disallow space before semicolon

rules.name: no-ternary
rules.description: disallow the use of ternary operators (off by default)

rules.name: no-trailing-spaces
rules.description: disallow trailing whitespace at the end of lines (off by default)

rules.name: no-underscore-dangle
rules.description: disallow dangling underscores in identifiers

rules.name: no-wrap-func
rules.description: disallow wrapping of non-IIFE statements in parens

rules.name: no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs
rules.description: disallow mixed spaces and tabs for indentation

rules.name: quotes
rules.description: specify whether double or single quotes should be used

rules.name: quote-props
rules.description: require quotes around object literal property names (off by default)

rules.name: semi
rules.description: require or disallow use of semicolons instead of ASI

rules.name: sort-vars
rules.description: sort variables within the same declaration block (off by default)

rules.name: space-after-keywords
rules.description: require a space after certain keywords (off by default)

rules.name: space-in-brackets
rules.description: require or disallow spaces between brackets (off by default)

rules.name: space-infix-ops
rules.description: require spaces around operators

rules.name: space-return-throw-case
rules.description: require a space after return, throw, and case

rules.name: space-unary-word-ops
rules.description: require a space around word operators such as typeof (off by default)

rules.name: max-nested-callbacks
rules.description: specify the maximum depth callbacks can be nested (off by default)

rules.name: one-var
rules.description: allow just one var statement per function (off by default)

rules.name: wrap-regex
rules.description: require regex literals to be wrapped in parentheses (off by default)

categories.name: Legacy
categories.description: The following rules are included for compatibility with JSHint and JSLint. While the names of the rules may not match up with the JSHint/JSLint counterpart, the functionality is the same.

rules.name: max-depth
rules.description: specify the maximum depth that blocks can be nested (off by default)

rules.name: max-len
rules.description: specify the maximum length of a line in your program (off by default)

rules.name: max-params
rules.description: limits the number of parameters that can be used in the function declaration. (off by default)

rules.name: max-statements
rules.description: specify the maximum number of statement allowed in a function (off by default)

rules.name: no-bitwise
rules.description: disallow use of bitwise operators (off by default)

rules.name: no-plusplus
rules.description: disallow use of unary operators, ++ and -- (off by default)
